description:
The first time I came here, I felt just ok about the ramen, but I gave it a second try and thought it was really good! Not sure if i ordered wrong the first time around or maybe I was in a mood...

I got the Tonkotsu the most recent time, which my usual go to at ramen places. It was flavorful and a good portion. We asked for chili on the side, which added that extra kick!

It wasn't too crowded so there wasn't a wait, even on a Friday night in the mission. Definitely a plus. 

The peach soju was tasty too!
author: Kelly G.

description:
This place was surprisingly good. My friend kept saying that because the Mission area is supposed to be good for Mexican food and not necessarily Japanese.

The price might seem a bit expensive but the bowls are decent size so it was justified. Plus it's San Francisco.

Our waitress recommended the Vegan Ramen. It seems like this one is quite popular and even non-vegans and non-vegetarians order this. I just added shrimps to it and on top of it the dish came with an extra plate of vegetables. It was great.

My friends had the Oxtail Ramen which came with a huge chunk of meat.

Overall great place.
author: Tim C.

description:
Just one of the those 'okay' ramen if you know really good Japanese ramen. 
Had Terrible headache after eat - possible too much MSG
Super slow service even only few customers there

Not impressed
author: Nao N.

description: I was hoping to like this place... but their soup bases were too salty and the portion of ramen was just a tad too small. I had the Spicy Miso and my husband had the Spicy Black Garlic. Neither were spicy so the salt and lack of spiciness were a disappointment. The ramen noodles had a nice consistency, though it would've been awesome if they had gluten free noodles. We had Gyoza as a starter and they had a delicious meat filling and were cooked perfectly. Their alcohol prices seemed outrageous. $25 for a 300 ml bottle of Karatamba!!! That's crazy. Crazy and too much salt isn't for me.
author: Jen L.

description:
Huge portions and pretty tasty fusion ramen. My partner and I got the oxtail and black garlic ramens. Both were very good and I actually enjoyed drinking the soup! Usually I find it to be too fatty or salty for me. If you want light bone broth flavor, go with the oxtail. For stronger flavor, the black garlic is the way to go.

We came around 7 pm with a reservation and the restaurant was a bit empty. However by 7:30 pm it got incredibly packed and busy so either make a reservation or go early!
author: Sophia H.

description:
I left the restaurant with it as a 4 stars.

I had the seafood ramen and it was fine, more like a seafood broth with ramen noodles rather than ramen. The lobster was overcooked and a bit rubbery, soft shell crab, shrimp, and clams were cooked fine. It costs $18

Boyfriend had the black garlic ramen and it was good too. You really need to like garlic. I had a spoonful of the soup and the garlic is overwhelming. I almost feel like it would be better as a tsukemen.

What brings it down for me is that I had a slight allergic reaction which I've only had when eating canned clams. I don't know if that's what went into the ramen. I've just only had this skin reaction with canned clams.

Considering the seafood ramen is the same price as ippudo I'm not sure the value compares.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Ushio is a fairly small shop so it's easy to miss when you walk around the Mission. This location is more rectangular than anything so the seating is mainly in the front of the restaurant while the kitchen/bathroom are farther down the hall. 

| WHAT WE GOT | 

+ Agedashi Tofu - YUM! This was a great starter. The tofu was fried perfectly and melted in the Tsuyu sauce. The added bonus was the bonito flakes on top.

+ Chicken Karaage - Another great option! They pair it with a spicy mayo sauce which isn't that spicy in case you were worried. The chicken had a nice coating and wasn't overcooked. They did a great job of creating a crisp while maintaining the moisture of the chicken.

+ Truffle Oil Edamame - I'm used to plain cold edamame when going to sushi/ramen spots so this was a nice change. The truffle oil paired with the salt added great flavor to the edamame. 

+ Black Garlic Ramen - This is something that I rarely see on ramen menus so I had to check it out! Even though they indicate this dish as spicy it wasn't what I was expecting. The black garlic broth had a nice kick but it had a slight burnt flavor (in a good way). It actually paired really well with the 3 pieces of chasu and the noodles were cooked perfectly. The addition of corn added a nice contrast to the other flavors in the dish that were very savory due to its tonkatsu nature. I also enjoyed that the broth here wasn't too savory but just the right amount of creamy to add depth but not make me full too fast.

Overall, the dishes here a nice change from what you normally see on traditional menus and were delicious. I'll be honest and will say that the black garlic ramen is not my all time fave, but since it's not on your typical menus I would try it out. 

| SERVICE | 

Service here was great. We called ahead to make a reservation and when we got there the table was completely set up with waters, silverware, etc and they let us sit down even before our whole party was there. They were attentive to our group and even chatted it up with us. 

PLUS - when they box your ramen to go they separate the broth and noodle vs. keeping them in one container.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Best vegan ramen I've tried in year--very umami with a variety of traditional and less traditional "toppings". Worth the $15. The service was decent, nothing to complain about. The atmosphere was clean and inviting, especially with the warm lighting.
author: Victor H.

description:
The most underrated ramen spot in SF! I almost don't want to write the review for fear of more people finding out about this place and generating a line! 

There's usually no wait which is hard to find for good ramen places in SF, so I love how I can get in and out fast in the center of Mission.

I like their oxtail ramen and black garlic ramen. The broth has great flavor and they don't skimp on the meat or toppings. The meat is always high quality. You can also ask for spicy chili oil on the side for free.

Eating at Ushio isn't an unforgettable ramen experience but it's a solid ramen joint that'll consistently hit the spot at a reasonable price.
author: Alicia L.

description:
Reasonably priced,  very flavorful ramen!  The space is casual and spartan,  but clean and organized. They have a good vegetarian broth option that even comes with a side plate of tofu and vegetables to mix in as you see fit.  

Pretty fast and thoughtful table service.  I'm a big fan of the spicy garlic tonkatsu ramen. Ramen is maybe a tad salty to be called perfect, but don't let that stop you. Easily one of my favorite quick bite or cold night dinner spots in the North Mission.  

They run a happy hour most nights until 630 where throwing in a beer with your ramen is cost effective and adds a little to the experience.
author: nate p.

description:
This ramen place is a solid spot in the city. No gimmick - just great broth, solid ramen, and tender meat that brings the ramen to a different level. 

We got the oxtail ramen. The meat was super soft and tender, very flavorful. It's so huge that we shared it between the two of us and I was still stuffed ( ask them to split into two bowls). The steamed clams was awesome. No sand in the clams (one of my pet peeves), fresh, and just right with the onions and flavor. 

This is probably my favorite for ramen in the mission for the moment. Small spot - cute and cozy but modern looking as well.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
A true oasis in a land of flowing burritos & ice cream.

The best thing about this place is that it is open very late on the weekends! I've always been a night owl of sorts but regrettably most other ramen places only stay open until 10pm if you're lucky. As a hungry preggo lady, the weirdest cravings often strike late in the evening and lately it's been ramen ramen ramen. Thank you Ushio for staying open until midnight on Friday and Saturday! And also for being smack dab in the middle of a fun neighborhood - lots of other things to do and see around mealtime.

While it's not the perfect ramen bowl, it sure is satisfying. The broth and the egg, arguably two of the most important elements of the bowl, could use some improvement. Broth is not as flavorful as some other places, it's true, and the egg has been inconsistent...this last time the outside of it was pretty hard and salty. The noodles are not as chewy as my favorite places either. But what i do like about this place in particular (besides their hours) is that they have a variety of bowls that i haven't seen before in other places...vegan, seafood, and my new favorite - oxtail! My grandma used to make oxtail stew often when i was growing up and i just love it. I know that oxtail is a pain in the booty to cook, so I take opportunities where i can to order it at restaurants. I personally feel like the brussel sprouts are a bit much with all the oxtail...I kind of wish it was maybe just spinach or some lighter green, the flavor of the sprout doesn't really seem to be cohesive with the rest of the bowl. All in all, a good effort and does the job for me.

The service is good too. Friendly and fast. I like that they play Netflix food shows while you're eating - makes me hungrier!

Lastly, i love that it's on the same block as the ice cream cookie sandwiches (also open late). Definitely going to be a regular here at Ushio! Husband also gives it two thumbs up.
author: Theresa C.

description: Can't remember what I got here other than the "black" ramen. Didn't think it was any special.
author: Victor D.

description:
New ramen joint in the mission! This location used to be a very mediocre bubble tea place, so I'm very glad it got replaced by something better.

I wouldn't say this is the best ramen in the city, but it is decent and very convenient to get to. Right now there is usually no waiting time either, which is a huge plus in my mind. 

I usually get an order of Edamame with Truffle Oil (delicious!) and then the Black Garlic Tonkotsu Ramen (their special) for main dish. I wouldn't super recommend the Spicy Miso ramen, not very impressed by it. I have also been warned that their Gyoza is a bit underwhelming as well, but I have not tried personally.
author: Angel C.

description:
My friend and I decided to come here for dinner because of how good the food items looked. And when the food came out it looked gorgeous. But sadly the taste didn't match how good the food looked.

I ordered the seafood ramen and was told that it was salty and I had the option to make it less so. I told the waitress to get me the regular version and honestly, even the regular version was super super bland and unsalty.

The broth just felt so unloved, like a watered down, plain seafood broth, it was pretty sad and I don't even know how they can complain about the broths saltiness when that would be the last thing I would complain about in comparison to what amounted to a boiled water taste.

The good thing was that the food toppings were decent, the noodles were well made and the pork was cooked decently well. The lobster was okay made as well though a little over cooked. Same could be said of the egg which didn't have a nice runny yolk.

But given that the highlight of ramen is usually the broth, the overall taste of it was just plain disappointing.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Ushio is a cute little ramen shop in the Mission District. I ordered the Vegan Lover ramen, and while it was good, it was *extremely* salty. For those who have ever dined with me, you already know that I am in love with salt, as I dump a ton of it on my food (it's kind of bad). That said, I'm wondering how those who don't share the same relationship with salt will feel about this soup. 

Nonetheless, aside from the salt, the flavor of the soup was good, they gave me tons of veggies (they even gave more on the side for me to add to the soup...but they were so salty!!!), the sponge tofu was good (which they gave me more of in place of mushrooms), and the noodles were medium thickness and firm. I asked the server if it was possible to make this soup less salty and they said I could request that next time, so I'll give them one more shot. If you don't like salty soup, I suggest you request less salty too!
author: Christina M.

description:
Great new ramen addition to the city! Came here on New Year's Eve around ~7pm and there was no wait for a party of 2. Along with the general ramen options, this place offers the lobster based ramen broth (which to my knowledge, the nearest ramen places that offer this is East Bay and San Mateo). 

I ordered the seafood deluxe (lobster broth with soft shell crab, lobster, clams, shrimp) and my boyfriend got the black garlic ramen. Serving portion wise, I would say this is definitely on the more generous side. Bowls were huge, the broth was rich and flavorful and they do not skimp on the toppings! They gave me two full pieces of soft shell crab (Ramen parlor only gives you 1!) and corn is included by default (most places charge you $1 for one small scoop). One minor complaint is that the broth was a little too rich and salty for me, but that is easily fixed as they offered to dilute the broth if wanted.

Overall-- generous and rich ramen, good service, fairly new ramen shop in the city so short wait. Would definately come back if I'm in the area.
author: Jenny N.

description: Great location in the Mission, good service and amazing ramen. Recommend the oxtail ramen. Bonus- the beer is super cold served in a iced glass. We'll be back.
author: Marianne L.

description:
Excited customer service! We were planning to try out their hour; however, we missed the time because we spent most of the time looking for parking. Saturday night try to find a parking spot at Mission could be really difficult in. Even thought, we missed their happy hour, I still wanted to try their ramen. It was one of the places I book marked. We came in after their Happy Hour but still got seated right away.  Which it was good because we were hungry.  We were pleased with the food and I love how clean the restaurant is. Here are the food that we ordered : 

* Deep Fried Chicken Karaage 
* Salmon Poke 
* Tori Tonkotsu with Corns 
* Seafood Deluxe 
* Green Tea Cheese Cake 

Deep Fried Chicken Karaage, it tasted like popcorn chickens to me but I wish they come with a slice of lemon. So can squeezed some fresh lemon juice over the chicken karaage. 

Salmon poke (I believe that I was the name), it was a new item on the menu.  It was salmon mixed with mango  and avocado served with crispy wonton skin over spicy dressing .  I can't eat spicy ; therefore, I asked to have the spicy dressing on the side.  This dish tasted yummy by itself already. Since it had avocado, it added a nice creamy tasted to the dish. ( I love everything with  avocado ) 

Tori Tonkotsu, it was a huge bowl of ramen. I couldn't find it. The broth was super rich and the meats were soft. I love the  soup .. I almost finished all the soup in my bowl. 

Seafood Deluxe, it was comes with shrimps , clams, half of lobster, mussel , soft crab, egg and corns.  My husband loved his bowl of seafood ramen, because he is seafood lover.  I tried the broth, it had a really rich shrimp tasted in it. 

Green Tea Cheese Cake, it was light perfect dessert to end the meal with after all the flavorful food. 

Overall, it is an average San Francisco prices tag meal. Definitely, will go there again and try their happy hour  menu.
author: Stacy L.

description: Had dinner here with 5 other family members. Overall everything was very good. Three of us had the oxtail ramen which was quite tasty. I especially liked the Brussels sprouts which was a nice surprise as it's not a typical veggie used in ramen. I just happen to love b. sprouts. The oxtails were fall off the bone tender. The only tip I'd give is they should trim off some or most of the fat as most of our oxtail pieces were surrounded by thick layers. If not for that it would have been perfection.
author: Mr S.

description:
First off, I really like the ambiance of this place. The beautiful food pictures/paintings on the walls, the wood tables, the great service, the semi-loud top 40. I really wanted to love it all.

But that's where it fell off for me. I got two different kinds of ramen, the Spicy Black Garlic Tonkotsu, which came with two pieces of very thin meat and some corn and seaweed, (which our waiter said was the most popular) as well as the Tori Tonkotsu (chicken broth), and both were very meh. I didn't think they were very flavorful, and could have used a bit of salt, actually (which I never thought I would say for ramen). We got the drunken clams as the appetizer, and not only were they a VERY small portion, they felt unsatisfying. The clams sat in a slightly garlicky broth that simply wasn't delicious. 

Once again, the service was really great, but the food itself was nothing to write home about.

There were so many other restaurants in the area that seemed tasty. I unfortunately won't be coming back to this one.
author: Cy N.

description: The Seafood Deluxe was delicious! Not a lot of seafood in it, but there was a reasonable amount. I ended up really full. My friends also enjoyed their bowls!
author: Jenny H.

description:
I loved their vegetarian ramen even though there was only one option! It was the right level of spicy (well..I did have to request that) and full of good veggies. Overall, not excessively sodiumy and still flavorful. 

Most of all, what differentiated this place was the awesome service. Our server was really pleasant and gave recommendations and was super quick!! 

The place is new so the ambiance is nice and clean and modern. Super convenient location too!
author: Aria S.

description:
Wanted to try this place because it was new. It was not crowded on a Wednesday night and we sat at the bar. We ordered appetizers, ramen and dessert. All were great.

House made wontons - these were one of the best wontons that I've had. They come in a bowl of chili oil and garnished with onions. Cooked perfectly and so good.

Spicy black garlic tonkotsu ramen - I really enjoyed this. The broth was not too salty, which is what I prefer. It was thick pork broth with black garlic oil and came with the usual toppings. Noodles were fresh - it was a very satisfying meal. I finished it all! 

Green tea cheesecake - this was my first time having a green tea cheesecake and it was awesome. Not too sweet, either. 

Will come back!
author: Lillian B.

description:
Ohhh yass! 

First of, I just want to say having heard of brussel sprouts being in ramen sounds weird right? but hey I loved every pieces of it! roasted and soft at the same time, not salty since there's enough of that in the broth itself. 

came Roxie (movie theatre across the street) and suddenly my friend was craving some ramen. so Yelped it, this was actually our first or second choice, i forgot, but there was a line outside. not too many, we were nearly hangry but 20 min wait isn't that long compared to the other restos in the mission. why not just write our name down while we walk around and decide. luckily we sticked to the plan and stay here for some ramen. the inside is a pretty decent size, i guess. nice casual ambiance, decor is simple - not too much going on, i like it. Customer Service -- our waiter was polite when we were seated with our menu handed to us. he asked us if we have any questions and concern about the menu which is nice to hear sometimes without rushing us to order.  they were pretty attentive, so that's a plus! because i wouldn't want to flag down any waiter just so we can get more water from all the sodium in the ramen ha ha. 

on to the fooddd... I probably had the most basic ramen here which is the Tori Paitan (a milky chicken broth). delishhH! I've had japanese ramen at other places in San Francisco but to be honest this is probably of one the good spot I would visit, when i crave it again besides Marugame (just becus it's the closest uber ride from me). Don't get me wrong Marugame is good too, but anywho.. love how the flavor compliments the chashu and rest of the toppings. the broth isn't too fatty and salty, it had its perfect balance. who loves their ramen full of sodium? I know not me. the portion is normal but more to than usual? Usually when I eat ramen (everyone have their own ways), i like to eat all my noodles/toppings then the broth and majority of the time i don't finish the broth, but here my bowl was literally empty. that's how good i thought the place was. plus we had soju & beer (somaek) with that. 

I'd say it was such a delightful evening before a night out to the bar that's lined up the street of mission and valencia.
author: Deneb T.

description:
Great location! I was super eager to try out this new ramen place near Dolores Park - it really is in the center of Mission. They just opened so they are probably still working out the hijinks of the workflow. Regardless, it has been so cold lately that I'm sure they are getting great business.

The ramen here is delicious, just a little too salty for me. We ordered the drunken clams and then the spicy black garlic tonkotsu. The drunken clans are such a unique appetizer to include. The broth they come in is warm and it does not taste very seafood-y. I think it was definitely smart to include the "black" in black garlic because many people are taken aback when they see their bowl of black-colored soup. The ramen came with a soft-boiled egg and enough veggies. The noodles could have been slightly more al dente but for the price, the ramen here is pretty good. I will probably ask them for a slightly less salty broth next time.
author: Connie L.

description:
Originally Katea (which never got its cold brew smh), this spot has transformed into a small ramen place. Great addition to the Mission but the hodgepodge of furniture (tall tables barely a foot away from short tables and a low-rising bar) feels as forced as its attempt to become a legit ramen shop. 

I tried the ushio spicy miso (not spicy) which had all the right toppings but the broth, which was decently flavored and somewhat creamy, was on the salty side. The noodles are not QQ or thicc, rather thin and like that of your typical TOP RAMEN even though I recall the menu claiming it was home-made (??) which is hard for me to believe.

They ran out of the ox-tail ramen, unfortunately, but I wouldn't mind going back to try it out. It's not bad in terms of fast ramen but nothing on par with marufuku or mensho.
author: Lydia Z.

description: More on the Americanized ramen than your traditional Japanese ramen. I been wanting to try this place ever since I been on that ramen craze. I got the spicy miso tonkatsu with a side of chicken karaage. The restaurant wasn't very busy at the time, but the wait for the food took a minute. The broth was okay to me, it was a tad too salty and kind of lacked flavor. The noodles had a nice texture though. Their chashu wasn't very flavorful as well. This spot is decent for ramen and I'd probably give it another try.
author: Lisa W.

description:
This up-and-coming ramen place wasn't bad at all. The service definitely stood out - the waiters were extremely attentive to keeping our water filled, and one even noticed that I looked like I had a question and came over to answer it. The ramen was pretty good as well.

The appetizers we got were more okay. The seaweed sashimi was a bit strange - they were like gelatinous mobius strips when we expected something more like a seaweed salad.? But they were refreshing when dipped in the ponzu sauce. The spicy chili pork wontons were also okay - we would have preferred a thinner skin and more filling.

I ordered the first ramen on the list, which came with chicken broth. The portion size was perfect and I enjoyed the texture of the noodles. I also appreciate that it came with a boiled egg. The only thing I'd say is that the chicken broth kind of made the two pieces of pork taste like chicken. For that reason I'd go for ramen #2 next time, which also has pork broth.

Overall the prices here are reasonable and it was comforting to get ramen on a chilly night. Playing Chef's Table on a flatscreen by the counter was a nice casual touch too.
author: Laura C.

description:
I admit I was suspicious of this place because the menu seemed more like mainstream commercial msg-laden ramen than crazy fanatic broth-purist ramen. I only ended up here because they ran out of broth at Nojo and I was too lazy and hungry to get in line at Mensho or Marufuku. Thanks to yelp, I found Ushio, which turned out to be a perfectly good alternative.

We got the Tori Paitan and the Tori Tonkatsu. Strangely, we found ourselves preferring the Tori Paitan even though it's thin (compared to Mensho's) and not gingery (unlike Nojos). I liked that they took a chance with some of the toppings, including the use of fried brussel sprouts. The service was also super nice. They'll even let you order extra soup- a huge bonus if your a broth and salt fiend. :)
author: Jean L.

description:
This ramen is really dope. I ordered delivery and the broth came seperately from the remaining ingredients. The beef broth is so delicious I saved half of my portion and ate it again the next day! I want to go as far to say it's better than any of the ramen I've had at the restaurant. 

Gyoza was meh, but that didn't really matter with how delicious the ramen was.
author: Hannah Y.

description:
Had the spicy black garlic tonkatsu ramen. Got it mild. Chashu was not tender - it was rough but fell apart. That's not tender, that's just gross. Soup was bland when ordered mild and very salty when ordered regular. Noodles are fine and the egg was decent though. 

The tempura was not good - batter had no flavor and was dense. 

The fish on the sashimi wonton app was very fishy and drenched in sauce. 

Hard pass on any return visits.
author: Erika C.

description: 3 stars based of food quality - its not too good, its not too bad. I expected more in Ushio but well, we random ran into Ushio after not being able to get seated in LoLo'. Ordered roughly 8 plates, 3 beers so the bill totals in $100. Inside is very clean and modern looking kind place.
author: Jenny N.

description: Came here on a Saturday night and was really craving ramen! The ramen was okay though, i got the spicy black garlic tonkotsu and boyf got the regular tonkotsu and we shared their Japanese wontons. I'm pretty sure they burnt the garlic in my ramen because the broth was really bitter, the regular tonkotsu was just okay too. When I think of ramen I think of hearty and comforting, but I felt like this place lacked depth in their broths. The noodles itself despite claiming they are homemade were also disappointing. There was no chew and they were really soft. The wontons I actually liked, but I feel like you would have to have an acquired taste because my boyf hated it LOL. You can definitely taste the ponzu and citrus but there was this weird sour ish aftertaste. Overall this place is just okay, the service staff was Really night though and attentive!
author: Erica L.

description:
A ramen place in the mission?! YES!!!!!! Came here on a Friday night around 7 and beat the dinner rush but it definitely gets busy so prepare for a wait! There's surprisingly quite a bit of space inside but probably wouldn't recommend for large groups (I.e over 5). Service is quick and friendly!

Okie so I friggin love ramen with a burning passion of a million suns. But I am also vegetarian and have been for the last year and a half, so finding decent ramen places WITH vegetarian options can be tricky. Look no further veggie fam, USHIO GOT YOU COVERED! They have a vegetarian option, which is named the vegan ramen (slightly misleading for all ya vegans out there bc it says it's a vegetarian broth so not sure if it's actually vegan). The issue with most vegetarian ramen is the broth. The broth is the most tricky since vegetarian broths usually aren't as rich and flavorful but Ushio has beat the odds! The broth is plenty flavorful, rich, and everything you'd want in a ramen broth. It comes in a huge bowl with a large heaping of noodles, and most of the toppings on the side. I added an egg to my ramen for an added cost. It's nice that they put the toppings on the side but I would've preferred if they just put everything in their for me. If I didn't want a certain vegetable I could've just told them but meh! There's an interesting variety of veggies in the vegan ramen including Brussels sprouts and some sort of sweet potato I think. Also eggplant! And fried tofu! All the toppings were really delicious and I think covered in a sauce? It's very VERY decadent ramen. The flavors are rich and bordering on overwhelming but the noodles sort of balance it out. It's definitely my favorite vegetarian ramen that I've tried. Check it out if you're veggie or not! Either or I think this is a SOLID spot for ramen in the mission.
author: Amy T.

description:
My friend and I came here on a Sunday at 6. The place was pretty empty when I got there and we got a nice spot by the window.

I ordered the Ushio Spicy Miso with extra chili on the side. I found that the ramen is waaay too salty and I wasn't impressed that the extra chili they gave me was sambal oelek (I'm particular about my chili lol). I tried my friend's black garlic ramen, which tastes a lot better than mine I think.

Since I live in the Mission, I probably will come back and try the black garlic ramen for myself.
author: Novalina N.

description:
I stumbled across this place on my way to my usual ramen spot at 16th and Guerrero, and decided to take a gamble on this newcomer.

Food was great with some cool ramen types I hadn't seen before: clam ramen and many with a combined chicken and pork broth. I had a crispy wonton appetizer that came with a delicious citrus sauce, and a pork ramen. The broth was super flavorful and the noodles nice and soft.

Topped it off with a nice bottle of hot sake, and it was a five star meal!
author: Nikhil S.

description:
Ramen in the Mission! Aw yis.

Having moved from Sawtelle, LA a year ago, I've been a little disappointed with the local ramen joints. Most are too fatty (Yamadaya), bland (Iza), or packed (Mensho) for my liking. Imagine my excitement when I learned about Ushio opening up just a few blocks away.

Convenience - It's basically on 16th and Valencia. Went for lunch on a Saturday at 12:30pm. The restaurant was about 50% full the entire hour I was there, which is great. I'm sure it'll get more crowded as more people hear about it.

Ambiance - They're going for that modern, clean look. It's forgettable but fine. A photo is worth a thousand yelp reviews on this topic.

Service - The staff was attentive and very willing to offer suggestions.

Food - The Spicy Black Garlic ramen isn't the best in the city, but it's solid. The cloud ear shrooms were a nice touch, the chashu was tasty, and the egg was perfectly runny. The broth could have been spicier though. The edamame and matcha cheesecake were bomb. GET THEM.

Price - A little on the pricier side, but this is SF ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Bad - Not feeling the use of comic sans on the menu.

Overall 5/7. I'll be coming back to try everything on the menu.
author: Eric K.

description:
I don't usually write any review, but I have decided to write this time. From the food to the service to the atmosphere, this jem in SOMA is definitely 5 out of 5 points. 

Food: 
The black garlic ramen is the best I've ever had. A must try item! ! Shio Oxtail is also on the spot. Highly recommended these 2.
Ramen, they claimed to be their own recipe, is perfect. Smooth and al dente.
Broth is so creamy and tasty. They really know how to made good soup without MSG added.
Chashu is MUCH BETTER than any other ramen restaurant I've ever tried. 

Service:
Warm welcome right after walked in. my friend misread the details on her Vegan Lover ramen, our server re-made her order without asking one word. This is called SERVICE!  !

Welcome to the neighborhood ！！！
author: Terry H.

description: Best vegan ramen I've ever had. Comes with delicious stir fry veggies on the side as well. Broth and noodles are to die for.
author: Katharine P.

description:
oooo i! i just dined on your apps toniteee
it musta been some kinda dish
i shouldaaa karaage, i shoulda prawn spice 8

straight from the gym = feed me bijz!
workout go animal then eat animals s'how it's done
vegans don't trip :p

(^_^) Eight Spices Prawns $8 ()
yay full shell on. plus fried kabocha

(^_^) Chicken Karaage $6.5 ()
dat yogurt dip doe

(-_^) Homemade Japanese Wonton $6.5 ()
ok

unavailable or i would've got...
(?_?) Fuji Mountain Salad $7.5 / 12
(?_?) ABC Smoothie $5

kate (the owner) sat at my 2top n answered a bunch of my random questions. the 3 big posters are ramen ingredients; i thought they were italian / mediterranean lol.

small clean mostly unadorned place, polite staff, 80s music!

i should revis for the softshell crab Fuji Mountain Salad.
author: Dan B.

description:
This place was great! Brand new and great addition to neighborhood. The food was excellent and the service was fantastic. 

Definitely coming back!!!
author: Reham A.

description: New ramen place! Came for dinner and ordered the black garlic tonkotsu ramen. Prettyyyy good. Only thing I didn't love were the noodles. They were super thin and reminded me of a pack of top ramen. The broth was the best part. Most of the time when I order "spicy broth," it's never really that spicy. But this one was actually on point. Plus, black garlic is my favorite thing ever with ramen.
author: Annie H.

description:
I've been here twice and both times were great.  The staff is very friendly and quick.  The ambiance is nice as well and they have a tv.  

I got the Spicy Black Garlic Tonkatsu and added clams and prawns.  I don't like mushroom, bamboo or corn.  The waitress didn't even bat an eye.  She let me modify and gave me extra egg since I took so much out.  The food came out quickly and correct! I also got a Sapporo. 

It was definitely a full restaurant when I finished and left around 7/730.
author: H R.

description:
my girlfriend was really excited to have a ramen place open up near her house so we decided to give it a shot. We got there around 6 and it was still pretty empty . She had the Black garlic oil tonkotsu with an added egg and I had the shoyu oxtail ramen with seaweed, corn, bamboo shoots . 

Ambiance 4/5- a bit chilly , not really a lot of tables but they do have the "chefs counter" which is always cool

Service - 3.5/5 although they were nice, they were also short staffed.( maybe they didn't think they would be busy ?)After trying to get ahold of the waitress 2 times I just walked over the to kitchen and asked for what I needed. 

Food-  the black garlic oil was definitely more oily then other ramen spots but it was the basic tonkotsu ramen flavors - 14.00? 

Shoyu oxtail - pretty bland, I was actually really excited cause i was randomly craving oxtail and bam! They had it but i wouldn't order it again. ESP cause I got one price of seaweed for a dollar, about 6 bamboo shoots for a dollar, only half an egg, 2 mushrooms and 2 Brussels sprouts with a spoon full of corn oh and extra noodles - started t 16.00 with add ins total cost 20.00

Overall, it's great to have a goodish ramen place but it's over priced and they are very skimpy on add ins. Like if I'm going to pay a dollar for seaweed AT LEAST put like 4 pieces ! I feel like ramen or any soup dish is a high profit dish (esp cause I'm sure they don't make the noodles in house) no need to be skimpy on the additional toppings
author: Lisa L.

description:
I'm no ramen connoisseur but I really liked this spot.

My dining partner in crime and I shared a starter of Eight Spice Prawn and it some fried sweet potato was mixed in with it. Not bad - it had like a Chinese 5 spice flavor to it and it was solid.

Shio Oxtail Ramen
Spicy Black Garlic Tonkatsu

I got the oxtail and it was tasty. And lots of it. The spicy black garlic tonkatsu was a bit overpowering with the garlic and spice so it was hard to pick up on anything else. But again, these were large bowls of ramen so can't complain there.

The service was spot on the whole time and the checked in on us constantly throughout the meal. The interior was clean and seemed like other spots you can find in SF.

I wish there were open for lunch so I could stop by more often but I could see myself coming again for an early dinnner.
author: Art O.

description:
Had the chicken karaage - very tasty and juicy. Not sure what the dipping sauce is made of, but was a flavorful bowl of creamy goodness that we haven't tasted before. Ordered the spicy black garlic tonkatsu dish. A good kick of peppery spiciness. Perfect ramen egg consistency and the soup was very good as well. According to the wife "there was also a good assortment of veggies" which I didn't bother with.  
The service was great. Restaurant is full of shiny happy people who were really courteous and kind.
author: Abe L.

description:
Came here on a cold New Years Eve, and was lucky enough to get seated right away.  I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, and it was bomb.  The broth tasted milky, and is a mixture of chicken and beef.  The chashu was pretty tender too.  Not the best noodles I've tasted either, but the service was really good!  Our server/waiter was literally running all
over the place, which may not have been necessary, but was appreciated.  

Also, they have alcohol, which is a plus :-)
author: Eric L.

description: This is hands down the worst ramen place I have been to in the bay area. I am giving it one star for the egg in the ramen which was perfect. The service is terrible as it took more than 30 min for me to get my ramen with empty tables around me. I was excited to try this place as they claim to have a black garlic ramen with no added MSG(judging by my headache after I am doubting this statement). Needlessly to say the ramen was disappointing. The broth was half oil and overly salty. The garlic taste and color comes mainly from floating bits of what seemed to be burnt garlic. The chasu was also tasteless and overcooked. My boyfriend had the lobster ramen, which was slightly less oily. The saltiness of the broth overwhelmed everything else.
author: Diane Z.

description: This is the real deal Ramen spot. Loved the edamame, gyoza, and the RAMEN!!! It's so delicious and the spicy miso is even better. It's a must, especially on a windy day in the city. We will definitely be back.
author: Marisa P.

description:
Ushio is a brand new ramen spot in the heart of the mission. 

Food Ordered:

Edamame with Truffle Oil
Deep Fried Chicken Karaage
Tori Tonkotsu
Kankisurui Chicken Ramen
Ushio Spicy Ramen

Drinks Ordered:
Sculpin IPA
Sapporo 

Edamame was delicious. The outside wasn't overcooked and the truffle oil was a nice touch.  5/5

Deep Fried Chicken Karaage was good but nothing too unique.  4/5

Tori Tonkotsu was decent. Good flavor but also very average.  Pork tasted delicious and the broth was good. 3/5

Kankisurui Chicken Ramen is the Ramen with no broth. I liked that the restaurant warned me about this. I did want to try something different but I was wrong to. It was too sweet and tasted like something I would have gotten at Panda Express. I'd avoid this dish like the plague. 

Ushio Spicy Ramen was delicious and the right amount of spicy. The broth was very delicious and the add one (egg, pork) made the difference.

I would visit again.
author: Enoch L.

description: I went here for the soft opening and it was pretty good. There are so many ramen places in the Bay Area though so my standards are set a little higher. The 4 star rating is mainly for the service and appetizers. The ramen itself was only 3 stars. We got the Japanese wontons and chicken karage to start. The wontons were tasty but didn't have a lot of filling inside. The karage was delicious. I got the tonkotsu and felt like the broth was a little too salty. The portion size was pretty large which helps offset the expensive price. My brother got the seafood ramen and said it was good.
author: Krysten M.

description:
Ushio Ramen is a new ramen spot in the mission that replaced Katea. I was a big fan of the boba place and was really sad when it closed down, but I'm glad it was replaced by this pretty decent ramen spot. 

I came here on a Monday night and only waited about 10 minutes for a table, although we did have to share a table with another couple. I was able to try the edamame and the wontons. BOTH WERE BOOOOOOMB. I wish I got to try the clams, I saw other tables with them and they looked delicious. 

Ok now on to the ramen - I got the spicy black garlic ramen while my boyfriend got the tonkatsu ramen. My spicy garlic broth was so interesting. The garlic definitely packs a punch. It tasted smoky and I didn't know what to think of it as first but as I kept sipping on the broth, I liked it more and more. The cha-shu was sooooooo tender, I wanted more!! I tasted a bit of my boyfriends tonkatsu ramen and it definitely wasn't as flavorful compared to my garlic broth but it was still good, it tasted really homey and comforting and exactly the way tonkatsu ramen should be. 

Service was a little slow - it was a packed night and there was only 2 servers - but it was understandable. The restaurant itself is really small, perhaps one of the smallest sit-down restaurants I've been to, which will probably make this place really inconvenient to get a table once it starts getting more popular. But in terms of ramen and appetizers, this is a solid place and I would definitely come back.
author: Cindy F.

description: I ordered the dry ramen and based on the one review didn't really have very high hopes. But as Joey says in Friends - what's not to like? Ramen - good!, Brussels Sprouts- Good. Chicken - Good. Go for that kankisurui chicken y'all if you end up here not quite ready for the soupy goodness of .
author: Ellie P.

description: So good, I got the black garlic ramen, and fried chicken. My friend Sean got beer I got tea, we are so happy. My friend Chris who is dieting for a photo shoot had his girlfriend come over and the waiter asked her if she wanted anything, they both said no, and I was like they have a photo shoot so they can't eat, and the waiter was so nice about it. Then I bought white rice and made them even more hungry. The food is soooo good. top 2 fav ramen places of all the , only not #1, bc I'm sure there is one better, but I don't know yet
author: James C.

description:
This is the first ramen place I've been to in SF, but have had many different versions of ramen in numerous cities around the world. The staff is extremely friendly. We were seated in the area of our choosing and when we joked about moving tables out front because it was a beautiful night, the waitress was willing to oblige.

Unfortunately, the ramen left much to be desired. Firstly, the menu was relatively homogenous and predominantly pork-based (nothing against those who enjoy pork, of course). I do not eat pork, and the staff was willing to substitute broth and other ingredients. The food arrived quickly, which was great. However, my dish was not delicious. It lacked flavor and the fried chicken I received as a side had an odd taste. 

I gave the restaurant three stars because the staff was five star while the food is one star, in my opinion. The three people I ate with felt the same. I'd give the place a shot if you're in the area, but don't expect too much.
author: Michael K.

description:
We got the tori tonkatsu and drunken clams. 

The drunken clams were amazing!!! The clams were very fresh and full. The soup was delicious, not creamy but thick in flavor. The garlic added an aroma to it. 

The tori tonkatsu was very good too. The noodles fully soaked in the soup's flavor. The soup was just the right degree of deliciousness, not too salty not too bland. All the ingredients tasted fresh and well made. Interestingly, overall I think it's a Chinese take on Japanese ramen. 

Will come back!
author: Iris H.

description: Seriously some of the best ramen I've ever had (and I have Ramen every time I come to San Francisco). Service was really friendly too.
author: Tamer M.

description: The seafood ramen looks pretty good but it's quite salty. I have been drinking lots of waters after I finished it. Maybe try another  next time. My friend tried the tonkotsu ramen and it's good. It's really hard to find parking!!!!!
author: Rita H.

description:
Amazing place to have vegetarian ramen! One if the best I had. It even comes with a side of seasonal vegetables which is really nice. Broth tastes great. 
Stuff is very nice, very kind and welcoming. They really care about you having a nice experience. 
I've been here four times and I'll definitely come back again and again. Just keep being as you are now!
author: Milos L.

description:
We had the seafood and oxtail ramen. 

Flavors were flat. Almost no umami flavor in the broth. Do not plan on going back.

Seafood ramen comes with half a lobster tail, which was cool, but didn't help the overall dish. 

Oxtail ramen came with a large amount of oxtail meat.

They get 2 stars for large quantities and speedy service. 

Understandable why this ramen spot is largely empty Saturday night for dinner.
author: Maaiz K.

description:
Great ramen! Lol 
Their Tonkatsu ramen was perfect for me. Not to heavy on the broth and noodle had a medium firmness to it.
Their drinks is refreshing I love their strawberry mojito.
author: Adrian N.

description:
I'm really hovering between 3.5 and 4 stars.

My bf and I came in on a sunny Saturday afternoon about 30mins before closing. Place was not packed, but not empty, either. We were seated promptly and I ordered the spicy black garlic tonkatsu, while he ordered the Ushio spicy miso. Our food came out in an adequate time. 

I tried some of his broth, and I'm not a fan of miso flavor with ramen; I like my miso in plain miso soup, so his just tasted OK to me. With regards to my spicy garlic tonkatsu, it was not spicy, more oily (the latter understandable). The former was fixable with their chili powder and hot sauce (both upon request). The hot sauce was more like XO sauce mixed with that garlic chili sauce that looks like sriarcha but in a jar with a green cap minus the rooster on the label. Personally, I love XO sauce, so I really enjoyed either take on "hot sauce". I was, however, disappointed that there was little to no garlic flavor. The ramen noodles were of the typical wavy type. I enjoyed my first few bites, but since both the broth and the bowl were piping hot, I think the noodles continued to cook while I was eating. I don't eat very fast (but also not a snail pace), so I actually noticed that my noodles had gotten soft. This was a little too well-done for my taste. In any case, both of us enjoyed our lunch (my bf preferred my broth over his). Why the potential half bump down to 3.5 stars? Well, I ended up being extremely thirsty for the rest of the day! I know ramen tends to be a little salty so it may be typical for others to experience this after effect; however, I don't. I feel like the saltiness was masked by the other flavors within the broth. .. in any case, I'm on the fence with whether or not I'd return. I've definitely had better, but I did leave the restaurant feeling satisfied.. but maybe I was just really hungry (I had just gotten off work at that time and was starving). A possible try if you're in the neighborhood and have a hankering for ramen, but I don't think I'd go out of my way to come here.
author: Leslie C.

description:
My friends and I were hovering around the neighborhood and wondered what to eat for dinner, then found out this new restaurant just opened a few weeks ago. We ordered the drunken clams and fried chicken appetizers, which are sooooo good.  Definitely recommended. 

They have some untraditional ramens such as the sweet and sour chicken ramen I ordered, it was surprisingly yummy. The spicy miso ramen my friend had was also tasty and delicious. 

The service was excellent. 5 out of 5 points!!
author: Yvonne Z.

description:
My wife loves the Vegan Lover and has ordered it many time for eat-in and take-out. I had the Spicy Black Garlic Tonkotsu on our first visit and it was fantastic. On our next visit I tried the Minced Chashu Rice Bowl and was blown away. So good!  I got it every time after. Unfortunately, I tied to order that on 2018-06-24 and was told they took that off the menu. :( I tried the Teriyaki Chicken Rice Bowl instead and it was very good, but I still miss the minced chashu. I hope they bring it back.
The service has always been very welcoming and quick, the restaurant very clean, and their take-out has always been well packaged. 
Highly recommend.
author: Matthew E.

description:
Overall an ok place for ramen with broth. We went here Friday for dinner at 7, and there was no line. We started with the truffle oil edamame which was tasty. I got the Tori Tonkatsu which was fine... the chashu was very thin and the noodles were okay. The reason I'm giving two stars: My boyfriend got the kanikisurui because he likes brothless ramen, but it was awful. 

The chicken was drenched in what smelled exactly like funnel cake batter before being deep fried, and the accompanying sauce was far, far too sweet. The brussel sprouts were ok but did not match the rest of the dish in flavor. Nearly inedible. They should probably drastically alter the recipe or remove it from the menu.
author: Leanna M.

description:
Look, I hate using Yelp to hate on a restaurant, but honestly Ushio Ramen disappoints. I honestly hope they start to read these reviews and notice an underlying issue - their ramen is way too salty!! I tried the Seafood Deluxe for $17.95 and I could barely eat it. The broth was way too salty and the lobster was way overcooked to the point where it was stuck in its shell. 

The kicker was that when we were ready to pay, the server asked if I wanted my food to go. I said, "oh no thanks, it was waaaay to salty to eat". She replied "oh". And then went to the bar area to pour some water. No attempt to let her cooking staff know or mention. I wasn't looking for a free meal, which is why I just said it after we paid, but there was no attempt to provide feedback to the cooks. Which is why I decided to write this review. I want small businesses to succeed but how can you be better if you don't take the customer's feedback. And after searching these reviews more carefully, I see that I'm not the only one who feels the same way about the salt level.  

Bottom line: 
If the cooks don't read this and make improvements to scale down their salt, save your money for somewhere else in SF.. or even top ramen, which will be less salty than what Ushio is currently serving.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
What an awesome and delicious place! Found this little gem one night wandering the Mission with the hubby  We ordered the Oxtail Ramen and Black Garlic! Both were exceptional, the broth was flavorful and rich. Noodles were perfectly cooked and had the right chewiness. The portions are fairly large. I would like to say the best part was the warm greeting and great customer service provided by the staff and friendly owner. We loved it so much we knew we had to bring our parents for a tasting :) 

We returned tonight to celebrate my FIL's birthday ( a true connoisseur of noodles) to this lovely business. He gave it two thumbs up and my MIL had the seafood ramen, which was a big heaping bowl of goodness! I would highly recommend you give Ushio a try.
author: Shirley M.

description:
Rating based on food alone.
Ordered a tonkotsu ramen - $13.50.

Chinese restaurant under the guise of Japanese cuisine. 
If you like Ajisen ramen, you'll probably like this place.

The ramen noodles were lackluster, texture and quality similar to myojo chukazanmai ramen packs. 

The broth was light enough you could drink it all, like pho or something. Not a plus in my book. 

The soft boiled egg was made well, however it was marinated with Chinese five spice instead of Japanese style marinade. 

Service and ambience is good.
However, It's worth mentioning that my party of 3 requested to be sat at a unoccupied table when half the restaurant and all the tables on the left were empty. The waiter told us it was reserved. We finished eating and left the restaurant in 45 minutes with the reserved tables still empty. 

We came at peak dinner time and there was no wait, I guess that's a plus.
author: Justin F.

description:
Excellent!
We ordered the Tori Tonkotsu and Seafood Deluxe ramens, both were delicious. The best part? The egg! Cooked to perfection and super flavorful (order an extra one)!!
Nice place and friendly service. I'll be back soon for sure.
author: Morgan L.

description:
Delicious, clean, safe, has a bathroom for customers

Black garlic ramen is kind of like the crispy bacon bacon equivalent of ramen. A little burned flavor buts that's a good thing.
author: Bryan K.

description:
Has a lot of potential but seems like it's still working out the kinks.  I was really excited to hear that a new ramen spot opened up in the Mission so I was eager to try it. I ordered the Seafood Ramen and my husband ordered the Black Garlic Ramen. First off, I was super impressed with the size of the bowls and how generous they are with the meat and noodles. My Seafood Ramen had soft shell crab, a lobster tail, clams, shrimp, etc. for a reasonably affordable price (by SF standards).  The broth was creamy, definitely seafood flavor, and rich.  The flavors of both broths were well-developed, perhaps a little on the oilier side.  However, after a few sips, it was quite evident that the broth was way too salty.  I think the addition of all of the seafood only added to the salt concentration and as they bathed in the broth, it only got saltier.  Most disappointingly, however, was that the handmade ramen noodles were way overcooked, to the point that they were mushy.  This was not true of all of the bowls ordered so it appeared that they were quite inconsistent in the cooking of the noodles. 

Service was pleasant and the space was nice and clean.  If they fix the level of saltiness and the doneness of their noodles, this will be a great ramen spot!  I hope they figure it out soon!
author: Jess Y.

description:
My fiance and I decided to stop by Ushio for some ramen on a cold Friday night, and it was so packed! We waited about an hour, and finally got a couple of seats at the bar.

We shared the chicken karaage - it was delicious, juicy, but needed some lemon or acidity. The spicy black garlic tonkotsu was good and had a nice heat to it. The noodles were nice and chewy, but the broth wasn't as flavorful as I would've liked. It also had a gritty texture, and my fiance thought it tasted a little burnt. He ordered the regular tonkotsu ramen, and I also thought it wasn't as flavorful or creamy as I like. Also, only half an egg for each bowl of ramen! 

For the price and the wait, I would rather go somewhere else, like Mensho or Marafuku. At least at Marafuku you can put your name down and go grab drinks elsewhere, instead of waiting outside in the cold people-watching as all the homeless bums walk by.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Nice new ramen spot in the mission!

Not life changing ramen, but never the less very good. Kind staff and ambiance. I ordered the tonkotsu ramen which had a flavorful broth- not too heavy or oily like other ramens you will find. 

The nice thing about this place is the selection of apps and all different kinds of ramen- including seafood ramen, chicken ramen, and other options.
author: Ian G.

description: Food is great. Appetizers are a good amount for the price. Food took too a little too long though -especially for a ramen place. The oxtail ramen is booomb. It's so tender, you can use one chopstick to pry the meat off it with not much effort
author: Aika C.

description:
Great customer service!
Vegan ramen was very good and flavorful. A lot of places have very bland vegan broths, but I really enjoyed this one. I love the variety of veggies they give you with the vegan ramen! 
Portions are really big too. Will definitely be going back.
author: Meera B.

description: Chilly night in the city called for some warm slurpy soup so we checked out this new joint. Their Chicken Karaage was the bomb dot com, my Seafood Deluxe was as delish as it looked, my wife's Spicy Black Garlic Tonkotsu was alright, but the Green Tea Cheese Cake was made in heaven! Service was great but parking could be a pain in the a**. Will definitely be back.
author: bombi r.

description:
So delicious!! I ordered the black garlic tonkatsu ramen along with an order of the wontons. The wontons were a good size for just me (because I was hungry), but would be a perfect appetizer for two. The wontons chili oil sauce was tangy and smelled mouthwateringly tasty. The black garlic tonkatsu ramen broth was incredibly flavorful with garlic (and whatever it is that gives it the black color), and had all the great characteristics of a good tonkatsu. The chashu and soft boiled egg were cooked perfectly, and the garnish of a feeling garlic cloves was a nice touch. The star of the meal was definitely the broth, though.

Highly recommend if you're in the area and looking for ramen!!
author: Samuel P.

description: Honestly, it's nice to find a place that's not selling overpriced pretentious food in the Mission. The ramens are delicious and pretty big, and it's not too expensive. Would definitely recommend!
author: Livia V.

description:
New Ramen! And only one block from home!


Always eager to try a new place for Ramen, my girlfriend and I decided to try Ushio which just happens to be a short walk away from our apartment. 
I was blown away by their SEAFOOD DELUXE Ramen which had lobster broth, fried crab as well as half a lobster tail and clams (and of course half of a soft boiled egg). 
My girlfriend decided to try a Spicy Miso broth ramen.
In the course of eating I noticed my broth was a bit spicy and I encouraged my girlfriend to give mine a try (not the seafood lover, I convinced her that it tasted nothing like lobster). 
Turns out, our broths were switched!! My girlfriend loved my broth and the spice, but thought hers was a bit fishy.
The servers were trusting and apologetic, understanding and kind. They made us new Ramen and all was right in the world. 
And what went from pretty good ramen with the wrong broths became GREAT ramen. 

We will be back soon; large portions, great staff, delicious food. Welcome to the neighborhood Ushio, we're happy to have you.
author: Tim W.

description:
Very cool contemporary decor.

The miso ramen was excellent and the vegge ramen came with 10lbs of vegge so that was awesome too.
author: Will D.

description: My cousin and I were sooo hungry and we happen to go in during happy hour! We ordered three appetizers: Salmon Civeche, Korean Fried Chicken and Gyozas. They were super good and we finished all of our apps. Our entrees we chose Spicy Black Garlic (I think that's what it is called) and Spicy Miso. The Spicy Black Garlic was not all that spicy. It seemed kind of chalkly. The Spicy Miso was great. It had a balance of everything and I can definitely say they are not stingy with their food! Good amount of portions for what you pay.  the staff was very friendly and the environment was sophisticated.
author: Shaina L.

description:
I've been waiting for this place to open because I live pretty close by. I ordered the Japanese homemade won ton, black garlic tonkatsu and green tea cheesecake to go cuz I was tired and wanted to be home. Service was great, really friendly. The wontons were good, spicy, but I'll probably try something else next time. Menu says they're served with chili oil and they're pretty oily because of it. The tonkatsu is also pretty oily, a pretty solid layer sitting on top. Tastes delicious but not worth the $15 or $16 for the amount of food you get- I got a few mushrooms, two slim pieces of pork and half an egg. The addition of corn is something different that I liked though. 
Cheesecake was really creamy and well plated, even in a to go box. Will def pick that up on nights when I need a pick me up, or when my period is waging war on me.
Will probably come again but dine in  and try different food.

TLDR; pretty good but the ramen is overpriced for what you get.
author: Kasandra K.

description: Very lively on a Friday night. Small place but good vibes. Didn't have to wait to get a table. Had the Vegan Lover ramen and the side of veggies it comes with is very good. Friendly service.
author: Nitesh D.

description: First time at this new spot - vegan ramen came with side of fantastic vegetables (to keep them from getting soaked/soppy. The chashu bowl wasn't traditional, but so comfort-food inspired (also a very large portion easily shared). Topped off with a refreshing honey green tea...!
author: natalie b.

description:
Nice place, prices were good and service was good as well.

Has a pretty limited menu though. Especially with Ramen in the name of the place I was expecting more variety.
author: Jeffery H.

description: This is some of the best ramen I've had in the city. Also reasonably priced -- about $13 for a huge bowl.
author: S Z.

description: Very excellent vegan ramen. Portions were big. Veggies came on the side and they were really good. Noodles were perfect. Broth wasn't that special though. Would come back
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Went here with a large group (10 ppl) and they were able to make a reservation for us. The waitress did a great job making sure we had enough beer. 

We shared some apps: the Edamame with Truffle Oil, the Homemade Japanese Wonton, the Deep Fried Wonton and the 8 Spices Prawns. The Edamame were definitely best, it group consensus as well. The other 3 apps didn't really stand out. Some of The 8 Spices Prawns were majority/all batter and the Homemade Wonton which is labeled as spicy, wasn't at all.

But their ramens were pretty good. I had the Spicy Black Garlic Tonkotsu which I would recommend but it was definitely on the 'blacker', 'charred' side of the taste spectrum. A bit intense. Whole, cooked garlic cloves in their too. But I tried some of the Chicken Wonton Soup & the Kanisurui Chicken Ramen (i.e. dried Ramen) which were good as well.
author: Alex G.

description: Went with friends during happy hour, ordered apps and drinks and also ramen.  I liked the food, I ordered the black garlic...but I love garlic.  One of my friends ordered the ramen with a chicken-based broth and she thought it wasn't very flavorful.  I'd come here again, the service was outstanding!
author: Kevin M.

description:
Sugoi. Good portions, very flavorful broths.

Would recommend black garlic miso ramen and the chasiu has a nice fatty smoked flavor to it. 

Shio oxtail is good if you want a less fatty but more meat-flavored meal.
author: Matt C.

description: I'm vegetarian and the Vegan Lovers is AMAZING! And the side of vegetables are soooo flavorful!! Highly recommend!
author: Amesh P.

description: Tasty, fresh food, and excellent service. Great spot to grab a bite before a show at the Victoria Theater.
author: Teresa S.

description:
I was eager to try this given that it had great reviews!  

What they do well:  They are trying!  We went on a soft opening and I will give them credit for trying their best.  They are unable to accommodate a influx of customers coming into the restaurant at once. Watching from the table, it is difficult to see other patrons being frustrated that the wait staff won't greet the incoming guests.  

What they need to improve on:  The soup base is A-ok. To be honest, I've had better! The stock lack flavor.  The owner also own tea shops and  Boba shops. I think they are spread too thin and given they own other stores around the Bay area, I don't think they have time to concentrate on making the flavor profile of what it takes to make this place a true gem. It has the potential.
author: David P.

description: Slow service, tendon-filled dark meat kara-age, not fresh packaged noodles, and middling broth.  Not good enough for me to return!
author: Don N.

description:
No wait on a Monday at 7:30 for two people. Service was friendly and honest (when I asked about the spicy miso he said it was salty.) 

The regular paitan was fine. A very chicken broth. The egg was salty and delicious. Noodles has a nice bite. The chicken karate was delicious!! 

I liked my friends veggie miso broth better than my chicken one so looking forward to trying that next time.
author: Nors P.

description: If I didn't get full, Id eat here forever.... top 2 Ramen places Ive ever been to. The Black Garlic Ramen thingy was amazing. Hot waitress too
author: Akash S.

description: I guess my expectations are a bit too high. I feel the soup is bland and the noodle are not as good as another ramen shop around the area. Good staff though.
author: Rico T.

description: Really good bang for you buck! $18 for seafood ramen with lobster tail??? Where else can you find a ramen spot with this option? The soup base and seafood was delicious, however, the noodle was okay. I definitely will be back.
author: Michael H.

description: They are generous.   That being said, they'd benefit from going to Hinodeya to improve upon their staple dishes.  Loved the additional and complementary servings but they've got to up their game.  Vegan broth was just okay and noodles were dense and sticky.  Complimentary veggies were nice but the tofu was over fried and squishy.
author: avi a.

description: Wonderfully friendly service, and absolutely delicious. We had the rice bowl and the spicy chicken ramen noodles. The best part were the wok fried Brussel sprouts, they were absurdly delicious. If I'm in town again I would love to go back and try their ramen.
author: Danielle C.

description: Ushio's Spicy Black Garlic Tonkotsu Ramen was very flavorful and the broth was creamy and well-balanced. The Chashu was a little thinner than I was used to, but still tasted very good! I'll definitely go back in the future.
author: Johnathan W.

description: Yes yes YES! The vegan ramen. The truffle oil edamame. The sesame balls for dessert. Obsessed.
author: Stacey J.

description: Great service. Nice servers. Terrible tasting food. Our dishes were nothing but salt. My wife and I were so incredibly disappointed. The chicken ramen was salty, the brussels sprouts were so salty,  both the ramen and the chicken were incredibly salty. The shrimp appetizer that showed up 10 minutes into the meal had no taste. I hope they were just having a bad night and someone screwed up, but the amount of saltiness in our dishes was insane. There is no way someone decided that these dishes were to be this salty on this menu. I hope to god someone screwed up tonight in the kitchen, cause seriously, never again.
author: Nima A.

description: In addition to the friendly staff and quick service, the food is fantastic. I had the vegan lover and I never knew vegetables could taste that great!
author: Candice C.

description: Was meeting friends in the Mission for drinks, so I decided to stop in for some Wonton soup. Friendly service, the portion was generous and the broth was very flavorful. The actual wontons were okay, too much dough though. The food was good but extremely over priced. They charge a $1 per condiment and $4 for the most watered down green tea I've ever had in this city. What should have been maybe a $15 meal was over $20 for one person. I ordered the wonton soup, chili sauce and green tea.
author: Anica S.

description: OMG! This is now my favorite ramen place in the Bay Area. Went with hubby for date night. Hubby got the seafood ramen. The lobster broth is extremely flavorful. The lobster is sweet and salty with great lobster flavor. The soft shell crab had the best tempura batter that only added to the flavor of the crab. All the seafood was delicious! The shio beef was very tasty and hearty. A great beef flavor. The oxtails are meaty and "fun" trying to eat with chopsticks. The noodles in both ramens was cooked perfectly. We also had the potstickers. Definitely homemade with a great dipping sauce. The broths for both ramens tasted different but were very tasty. Will probably order extra noodles next time. Looking forward to coming back to try the toripaitan and the drunken clams!
author: Lisa S.

description: In a time when ramen has been elevated by the likes of Hinodeya and Noodle in a Haystack (pop-up restaurant), this place is just ok. The wine list is also non-existent. Service is slow, but I think they're working it out since they just opened. But the food is just ok.
author: Patricia L.

description: The ramen was delicious, the service was fast,and the portions were perfect!  I sat at the bar and enjoyed a nice bowl of tonkatsu ramen along with a bottle of sake.  Great place to discover!
author: Jille E.

description:
As a ramen enthusiast, a lot of speciality ramen places usually focus on serving ramen with Tonkotsu (pork) broth, but this place seems to focus on Tori Paitan (chicken) broth.  And it was nice change of pace!  I really enjoyed the Tori Paitan broth.  

While they have an option that combines the chicken and pork broth for some reason that seemed unappealing to me and my boyfriend. 

We ended up ordering Gyoza and two Tori Paitan Ramens.  The Gyoza came in six pieces and had a tasty dipping sauce!  The Tori Paitan Ramen had some interesting toppings you don't usually see in ramen, most notably brussel sprouts.  I think it was weird to see the brussel sprouts when I first got it, but it must have been good because I ended up eating all of them haha.  

Overall, I'm really impressed with the Tori Paitan ramen because the broth was great, the noodles were high quality and the toppings while unusual were delicious.  

I only knocked off a star because its a little too pricey for me, for three items the bill came out to $45 with tip, but hey, welcome to SF!  The service was good though, I didn't have to ask for refills, but we did have to share one of those big tables.  

I'll be back!
author: Cristina C.

description: Really nice staff. Totally fine ramen that runs a little salty. It won't bring flashbacks to eating in Tokyo but it does the job.
author: Daniel E.

description: Nice atmosphere but poorly run. The ramen was extremely salty even though the taste was supposed to be spicy. I had the ushio spicy ramen. None in my party had anything good to say about the food. Next. Also, their portions are snack portions.
author: Mickey D.

description: Pretty delicious ramen, house made. I have been here twice already and I always get the vegan ramen, it comes with tons of grilled veggies, and the ramen itself has great noodles and broth. I had to deduct one star because it's overly salty, the last time I had it, it was so salty that I could barely eat half of it. I took the rest home and ate it later after a workout, and added a ton of water and half a bag of baby spinach while heating it up, in order to make it palatable. Not sure why they try to overcompensate a vegetarian dish by making it so salty. That being said, it is delicious otherwise.
author: Crystal Y.

description: Ushio ramen finally opened. Welcome to the neighborhood. I tried the spicy garlic tonkosu. It is amazing. The broth is very flavorful. I have to said that it's chaisu is the best. I was told that the chaisu is homemade. It is tender, juice and not too salty. I could taste the pork flavor. I also ordered strawberry mojo ice tea. I loved it soooo much. After a hot ramen bowel, the tea was very refreshing. Over all, i will give a 4.5/5.
author: Yoyo C.

description:
Great place, great food, and family owned!

I have been here twice and both times I have left humble and happy.  Both spicy ramen dishes are spot on.
author: David S.

description: I was here recently with my brother, and we know our ramen decently well. Although the service was friendly and prompt, and there are clearly many people who like the ramen here, we were unimpressed. Both of ours were much too salty and lacked finesse and complexity. Disappointing based on the Yelp reviews.
author: Bella S.

description: A delicious new neighborhood spot. Keep doing to-go orders! The soup and noodles are excellent, spicy is spicy with flavor, and service is friendly and nice.
author: Joe G.

description: Good here is good, but the sake is way overpriced, the restaurant doesn't have any sign with its name on it outside, seem to be purposefully, for the snobbish touch, and made us wonder in the street for a while before we found it.
author: Brent C.

description:
I don't really write reviews cuz Im running the business and understanding it's hard sometimes.
BUT!!don't let pictures fool you.I have ordered seafood ramen,and I couldn't even finish not even halfeven I was really hungry after long day.
It's way way tooooo salty!!No flavored at all.
I don't understand all ingredients are too salty.
Like salt shrimp and clam and lobster.Too much!
I paid $60 for 2 ramen and small hot sake.
Not worthwhile.Will never go back!!
author: Katelyn L.

description:
Like this spot a lot, good selection of appetizers and ramen. Def more seafood centric than many ramen places and they do the seafood incorporation well, particularly with clams. Highly
Recommend
author: Anant P.

description: This place has a vegetarian option which is awesome! I got the vegan lovers ramen and it was really good!! Will definitely be back!
author: Lima S.

description:
Nothing beats a bowl of hot ramen on a cold rainy night at SF. Found this place not too far from the bart station and looked busy. There was no immediate seating and we waited at a rather awkward position in the restaurant for 20 minutes. Thankfully the food was decent. My friend's spicy black garlic ramen had a kick, super aromatic and definitely great if you are into black garlic like my friend. I prefer just the traditional chicken and pork broth. The cha shu  is tender, the toppings are great, the noodles are done well. 
Nothing too special, but did its job.
author: Emily H.

description: Spicy Garlic Tonkatsu, very impressed. The sweet corn, roasted garlic and the perfectly braised pork had incredible flavor balance. Service was excellent, they let us call ahead and order was ready when we arrived (they were at last call).
author: Nigel W.

description: Been hard to find good meatless ramen - so now I have - decided to visit twice this week.   Their their vegan ramen is sooooooooo goooooood.  Mmmmm.  It comes with a heap of vegetables to add as you please - a bit oily but I like it.  Service is friendly and prompt.  Tony Bourdain on the TV by the bar - great for those moments when you run out of things to talk about during an awkward date.
author: Maria L.

description: Maybe I thought our collective fascination with Ramen was about done... and it has been awhile since I had ventured to any of what I think is about a dozen Ramen spots in a short walk from the household... but I'm happy this spot has arrived in time to provide some warm soupiness to the cold SF winter.  Good apps and solid ramen... with reasonable saki in a clean and friendly atmosphere.
author: Yosh K.

description: Not good. Broth is watery and flat. The noodles don't seem to be home made. And chicken Karages seemed to be frozen.
author: Soh R.

description: I've been here a few times and the staff has always been nice and accommodating.  I've tried a few different bowls but my favorite would have to be the ox tail and tonkotsu. For appetizers, you should try the  truffle oil edamame and chicken karaage.  Both are delicious and high in protein (if you like a post-workout snack).  I've been going here during the dinner hours and parking has always been quite easy if you park 2 to 3 blocks away!
author: Nelly Z.

description: Food and service was excellent. I had the Homemade Gyoza and Drunken Clams and both exceeded my expectations. I had a really great time. Very highly recommend.
author: Lin F.

description: I love it, great services and foods! The sitting is very comfortable! I will be come back soon! :)
author: Will L.

description: The  place has  a nice sitting  , I really like the seafood ramen , has a lobster tail and clam ,  fried chicken  and wonton with miso  was yummy :)
author: C L.

description: This restaurant i was first time to come here calling Ushio Remen its great on my first time.located on one of the busiest streets,lots of people always to go to eat there every day.there are several reasons i like this restaurant.first,in terms of food,the restaurant offers a Remen and Appetizer,i like this restaurant also because of its environment.whenever you go to there it is clean and various decorations are always thoughtfully arranged in different places.nonetheless,the service there is really excellent.all the waiters and waitresses are well-trained in manners and tricks.Finally when it comes the price,it will be more reasonable.
author: Show Z.

description: Really cool place! Was walking in the area and stumbled by this and decided to give it a try. The service was really great and the waiters were very friendly and professional. The food was really good; my favorite was the chicken karaage. Highly recommend if you are in the area and looking for some ramen. It was really clean too which is always a bonus.
author: Krista L.

description: It's super awesome to have a ramen spot in the mission, right by 16th and Valencia, the location is really fantastic. The ramen is well made and delicious, I would suggest the spicy miso ramen which is my favorite.
author: Ryan H.

description: My friend in the neighbourhood recommended this place, so I decided to try and it really surprised me. The fried chicken is perfect! The seafood deluxe is awesome! The service is excellent! The environment is very untraditional but I like it.  I can't wait to come back to try all other items on the menu. Highly recommended!
author: Stanley W.

description: The service here was very prompt and friendly. I felt very welcomed when I first came here! The ramen is also amazing. I was surprised by how rich the soup was. It wasn't watery or over salty like other places. I always order the Ushio Spicy Miso whenever I come here.
author: Henry L.

description: I really just thought this place was ok! The service was good, but the ramen was nothing noteworthy. I did however get the veggie option because I am vegetarian. So this makes a difference of course. Love the veggie ramen at other places in the city though!
author: Kelsey C.

description:
This is an amazing ramen place! I ordered the Ushio spicy miso and absolutely loved it. The broth was very rich, creamy, and flavorful. I really liked the texture of their noodles and the pork was very good.
My friends ordered the seafood deluxe and the vegan lover. The seafood deluxe was very delicious and came with a good amount of seafood. The vegan lover was also delicious and the broth was perfect. 
We also tried their konnyaku sashimi and their drunken clams, both of which were extremely tasty.    
The service was good, as the waiters are very kind and patient.
