I would definitely eat here again.
author: Judy L.

description: Fresh and delicious ramen. Not your standard ramen, really flavorful. The gyoza are fresh and so good. Highly recommend!!
author: Henrietta C.

description: It's first time here. I have been heard about it many time through my coworkers. They are the big fans here. I ordered a spicy miso and a truffle edamame. They are soooooo good. It's miso broth very tasty and strong soybean flavor. Nice decor. Very good service.
author: Liu H.

description: The pork chashu was really good. Th Vegan lover also came will stir fried veggies that was full of flavor, love the Brussel sprouts.
author: Victoria L.

description: Decided to try out the tori tonkotsu and gyoza, but the food service was slow even though it wasn't particularly busy (~20 minutes for the ramen) and the food was overall lacking. The gyoza was unremarkable in terms of flavor, but wasn't particularly bad (or good). The ramen noodles seemed like the kind you'd get from a pack of top ramen, the egg was bland, and the broth was watered down. The chashu was tender, but that was the only real positive about the ramen. Overall, the food and service were substandard and you'd be better off getting your ramen fix elsewhere.
author: Simon L.

description: Descent ramen and service. The vegan ramen was salty as other reviews have commented. I'd order again but next time ask the waiter to use less miso broth so it's less salty. Also ingredients didn't taste fresh. The miso tasted like it was from a machine and the vegetables on the side tasted previously frozen then sautéed in some sweet sauce. The tofu tasted like it was twice fried then sautéd in the sweet sauce which caused the out bread to be a bit soggy and less crispy. This is the only vegan option btw.
author: Leah M.

description: Nice venue with interesting broths. I still prefer Orenchi Byond and Santouka but it is nice to have a variety. I had the seafood delux which is ramen with lobster broth, soft shell crab, clams, chasu, soft boiled egg, and lobster. What I liked was the portions were big, the broth tasted fresh with seafood, and the venue was clean and fun. Customer service was on top of things. I do think their broth could have more depth and noodles thicker. All in all was not a bad meal.
author: Peachie Y.

description: Small cozy place tucked into a corner with super friendly staff and great food! Will definitely come back to visit again!
author: Ganesh G.

description: Service was terrible. Ramen wasn't good and the noodles seemed like instant noodles. I also got very sick after eating here. Also, way too expensive for the quality of food.
author: Pilar R.

description: Nice sleek decor. My friend and I sat at the bar. I had the Noodles with Oxtail and I was disappointed, the broth lacked any flavor. The meat was tender and veggies cooked fine, just no flavor in the broth. My friend had the garlic noodle soup and agreed that the broth was bland. We also had the Spicey Chicken wings, and no spice whatsoever. With so many ramen places I won't be returning.!
author: Jim W.

description: ...great little new place serving up a wonderful bowl of delicious ramen...I would most definitely revisit this establishment when next in the Mission...
author: Martin C.

description: This is the best ramen place I had ever tried! The soup and ramen is very delicious! I will come back again!
author: Carmen T.

description: This name of this ramen shop is supposed to translate into trendy, but no indication of this was given on the menu before we ordered.  I was looking forward to some delicious, salty, savory, umami ramen broth of the kind that is offered at a lot of ramen places, and instead the tori tonkotusu broth was acidic and strange.  Didn't have the depth of flavor that I was expecting.  Maybe my palette is not attuned to this kind of broth, but I would say that even something novel, or something with a twist should be satisfying and intriguing on first taste, and not leave you longing for a bowl of the more traditional stuff instead.
author: D K.

description: Was in the area and saw this cute joint. I had dinner soon but I still wanted to try it, so I got the chicken karaage. I didn't expect much since it's a new place, but wow! The chicken was so tender and not super greasy. It was light but still satisfying. Definitely down to come back and try the ramen.
author: Allis L.

description: The place is a nice hang out spot. Good experience with friends last night. I ordered the ushio spicy miso. Love the creamy soup with little kick of spice. Green tea cheese cake is recommended
author: Mi L.

description: My friend and i came here for friday dinner on our way back from sfo. Ramen being my favorite and comfort food, i was very happy to find it here. I ordered spicy black garlic tonkotsu and my friend ordered Ushio spicy Miso really it was awesome. if you are ramen lover you will not be disappointed with the quaity and quantity. i recommend this place to all the ramen lovers.
author: Dill B.

description: The host was friendly and the environment was pleasant, but the food really was not good. We ordered the spicy black garlic ramen and spicy miso ramen. The broth was so salty it was barely drinkable.
author: Elin K.

description: Really good ramen and seriously pleasant staff...suggestions: don't charge $1 for hot sauce and provide a small order of Edamame as a complimentary app (similar to chips and salsa at a taco shop)...ramen is a grass roots meal in Japan and should not go the snippety route that sushi traveled.
author: John A.

description: Yoooo. Like yooo. Got to give this place a try. Best is the oxtail ramen, seriously oxtail ramen and the chashu pork is amazing. Came here with a few friends during their lunch hour, friendly service and they got alcohol for you late night folks.
author: Billy A.
